name: Enhanced penalties when elderly persons are targeted
text:
If any person is found to have violated section 444-9 and the violation is committed against elderly persons, in addition to any other penalty set forth or imposed, the court may impose a fine of up to $10,000, or imprisonment up to one year, or both.  As used in this section, "elderly person" means a person who is sixty-five years of age or older. [L 1996, c 172, pt of §2]
Cross References
  Additional penalties for fraud committed against elders, see §480-13.5.
